JobFullDesc: Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.The position is for the design, development and integration of test equipment for satellite test and other space applications. The position provides an opportunity work with an experienced, interdisciplinary teams to develop or modify test systems in order to meet the challenging test requirements of our business partners and customers.The engineering function of Boeing Test and Evaluation El Segundo  (BT&E-ES) creates automated test systems and the hardware products used by our test operations teams onsite and at satellite launches. For test systems and hardware products, our group is accountable for all facets of engineering from technology investment, concept development, requirements and design, build, integration, test, verification and product maintenance. Our team of STE engineers provides every type of test asset to our user community -from multi-rack/system architectures to replacement cables and everything in-between.Boeing Test and Evaluation (BT&E) El Segundo  (BT&E-ES ) is seeking engineers to join our engineering team who are seeking the knowledge and experience gained in developing diverse test systems. Engineers must maintain detailed requirements and specifications for various electronic test products; develop detailed designs of varying levels of complexity for special test equipment (STE); conduct various methods of testing and verification of special test equipment (STE); provide basic engineering support and change control throughout the lifecycle of delivered products; and implement Model Based Engineering (MBE). Position Responsibilities:Serve as lead engineer in the development of automated test systems to test satellite power subsystems and simulate loadsDuties will include requirements and interface definition, modeling and analysis, performance metrics and requirement verification.Develops and maintains electrical product detail, assembly and installation designs (e.g., power supplies, harness routing and controllers)Validate designs through various methods of simulation/modelling, demonstration, testing and analysis.Provide engineering support throughout the lifecycle of the test equipment product.Mentor less experienced engineers in your areas of expertiseThis position requires the ability to obtain a U.S Security Clearance for which the US Government requires US Citizenship. An interim and/or final US Secret clearance Post Start is requiredBasic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):Bachelor's, Master's or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistryExperience developing and maintaining electrical product detail, assembly and installation designs (e.g., power supplies, harness routing and controllers)Experience with satellite and or test system power design, circuit modeling and analysis, performance metrics and requirement verificationPreferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):Active security clearanceExperience with mentoring, coaching, guiding, and leading teams of junior and peer engineersMasters degree in electrical engineering disciplineTypical Education/Experience:  Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standardRelocation: Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position.
